item.title: Hideo Kojima Will Present at The Game Awards 2024
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Hideo Kojima will attend and present at The Game Awards 2024, its host Geoff Keighley has confirmed.
  • The Game Awards 2024 will be the event's tenth anniversary.
  • Fans shouldn't expect a release date for Kojima's Death Stranding 2 at The Game Awards 2024, as the director says an announcement will take place in 2025.

The Game Awards executive producer and host Geoff Keighley has announced that Metal Gear and Death Stranding creator Hideo Kojima will attend and present at the show, which will take place on December 12 at the Peacock Theater in Los Angeles. Kojima is currently developing the sequel to Death Stranding , which was last shown in September as part of PlayStation's attendance at Tokyo Game Show 2024, but the highly-anticipated sequel is heavily speculated to appear once again at The Game Awards 2024.

This year will mark The Game Awards' tenth anniversary, meaning fans are hopeful for some big announcements and reveals. Game developers, on the other hand, will be looking to take home as many awards as possible. While the event will have numerous categories, such as best family game, multiplayer game, art direction, and many more, it is the coveted game of the year award that fans will be looking forward to most. Nominations for game of the year at The Game Awards 2024 include Astro Bot, Balatro, Black Myth: Wukong, Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth, and Metaphor: ReFantazio .

Hideo Kojima Will Attend The Game Awards 2024

Kojima's appearance at The Game Awards 2024 won't come as much of a surprise to those who know the relationship the game developer has with the show's host, Geoff Keighley. In a new post on Twitter, Keighley confirmed Kojima's attendance and noted that the illustrious director was present at the very first Game Awards back in 2014, so "he couldn't miss [The Game Awards'] 10th anniversary." Keighley also confirmed that Kojima would be attending the event as both a fan and a presenter, meaning he will be handing over an award for one of The Game Awards' many categories.

As for whether or not Kojima's attendance at The Game Awards means fans will receive another sneak peek at Death Stranding 2 remains to be seen, but hopes are certainly high. The highly-anticipated sequel to 2019's Death Stranding was all but confirmed by the game's star, Norman Reedus, back in 2022. An official reveal then took place at The Game Awards 2022, with multiple trailers and deep dives being shown in the years since. Given that the title was revealed at The Game Awards, a new trailer appearing at the 2024 show seems likely.

One thing fans shouldn't get their hopes up for is a release date for Death Stranding 2 , as Kojima confirmed back in September during Tokyo Game Show 2024 that a reveal for the game's release date won't take place until 2025. The director revealed that while the release date had already been decided, it could not be announced during the event "due to some unforeseen circumstances." Although Kojima didn't reveal what these circumstances were, he did confirm that a date would be shared in 2025.

item.title: How to Open the Locked Chest In Belvedere Courtyard In Indiana Jones And The Great Circle
item.description:
Players will come across several locked chests during their adventure in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle . The codes needed to unlock them often hide in plain sight, but sometimes, it's not so apparent. It's up to you to scan the area in search of notes or hidden clues that will point you in the direction of the code. One of these locked chests can be found early in the game, after entering the Vatican City inside Belvedere Courtyard. This guide will explain how to open it.

How to Open the Belvedere Courtyard Chest in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

The Belvedere Courtyard chest code is 5238 . Those looking to find this out for themselves will need to wait until after they've explored the secret passage under the Apostolic Library, at which point, they'll get the Clerical key from Father Antonio. Indy uses the key to exit the Library and head into Vatican City , where players should be able to see a soldier's tent right in front of them.

Make sure there isn't anyone around when Indy is picking up money to avoid them seeing through the disguise and attack.

Since you're disguised as a Cleric, the enemies won't catch you exploring the tent. You should loot some money and grab some fruit to increase Indy's stamina later. However, the main thing you'll want to do is open the locked chest, which harbors some valuable loot. Here's how you can open the locked chest in the Vatican City's Belvedere Courtyard in Indiana Jones and The Great Circle .

  1. There's a desk to the left of the chest. Open its drawer to take out a movie ticket stub .
  2. The number 38 is mentioned on the ticket stub, but the beginning 2 numbers are punched out. However, players can rotate the Ticket Stub to reveal the other first 2 numbers, which are 52 .
  3. Combine these numbers to form a code: 5238 , and use it on the locked chest to open it.

Opening the chest will allow players to loot some money and a 'Splinter Smash' adventure book . Taking the adventure book will allow them to spend adventure points (EXP) in the Journal menu to unlock the combat skill it offers, which allows melee weapons to deal increased damage on their last hit before breaking.

item.title: Stalker 2: Seek, And You Shall Find Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Start "Seek and You Shall Find" Mission in Stalker 2
  • Location & Contents of All the Journalist Stashes

Seek, And You Shall Find is one of the first side quests you’ll come across in Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl . Even though it’s completely optional, don’t sleep on this quest as it rewards you with some of the best weapons in Stalker 2 .

The Seek, And You Shall Find quest tasks you to find Journalist Stashes hidden all across the game world. These stashes contain valuable loot, including weapons and armor. While the locations of the stashes are marked on your map, they are not always easy to find. To help you out, this guide covers the exact locations of all the Journalist Stashes in Stalker 2 ’s Seek, And You Shall Find mission.

How to Start "Seek and You Shall Find" Mission in Stalker 2

The Seek, And You Shall Find quest becomes available after completing the main mission "A Needle in a Haystack” in Zalissya. Once this mission is finished, you’ll receive a hint to check your Private Stash.

Inside the stash, you’ll find the Journalist’s Flash Drive , which reveals the locations of all the Journalist's Stashes scattered across the Exclusion Zone.

Location & Contents of All the Journalist Stashes

Location

Journalist Stash #

Where To Find

Contents

Lesser Zone

#1

Found inside the attic of the building just north of Zalissya. To reach the stash, jump onto a truck outside the building and climb to the roof of the building. Once on the roof, look for a way to drop down into the attic. You’ll find the first stash here.

  • Mercenary's Light Suit
  • PTM Monolith Pistol

#2

Head out of Zalissya and move to the Military base near the Sphere. Here, take out the guard in the watch tower and enter the compound. Keep walking past the brick building until you see a ladder. Climb up the ladder, and you'll find the stash.

  • AR416 Monolith rifle

#3

Head northeast until you reach a large, abandoned factory. Climb the ladder on the side of the factory to reach the roof. Once on the roof, look for another ladder that will take you down to the roof of a nearby building. This is where you'll find the stash.

  • Viper “Monolith” SMG

Garbage

#1

Go to Garbage through the Northern Checkpoint in the Lesser Zone. Then, turn right at the first crossing and keep going until you see a big pile of broken stuff and cars. The chest is in a ruined van on the right side of this pile.

  • M860 Monolith shotgun

#2

Head to the northern part of Garbage till you reach a big junkyard called Maze. From the south side of the junkyard, you'll see a big yellow bus flipped on its side. Crawl through the bus and turn right. Jump onto the car, and the stash will be on the floor to your right.

  • Tourist Suit

Rostok

#1

Look for a one-story building in the northwest part of Rostok. This building is filled with strange anomalies and you'll need to use bolts to protect yourself from them. You’ll find the stash in a room at the end of the corridor.

  • Riemann AR

Chemical Plant

#1

Head to the Army Warehouses in the Chemical Plant. Look for a building next to a metal hangar. Climb onto the yellow truck outside the building and jump onto the ledge above the door. Climb through the window to get inside. Turn left and pull the lever to open the gate. Then, go into the room to the right of the lever to find the stash.

  • Lullaby AR

Yaniv

#1

Explore the northern border of Yaniv till you find an abandoned train. One of the train cars has a yellow lock on it. Break the lock to open up the door and you’ll find the stash inside.

  • Model Competitor revolver

Burnt Forest

#1

Head to the northern border of the Burnt Forest. Here, you'll find the ruins of a small building surrounded by fire. Once inside the ruins, climb down the ladder to reach the cellar. Defeat the flaming Poltergeist and safely explore the basement to find the stash.

  • SSP-100M SIRCAA suit

Swamp

#1

Go to Horodyshche Hamlet on the northern border of the Swamp and find a house with a red tractor nearby. Climb onto the tractor and jump onto the lower part of the roof. Use your knife to break the wooden boards blocking your way. Then, crouch walk through the attic to find the stash.

  • Veteran rifle

#2

Found in the southeastern corner of the Swamp. However, you can't access it until you've completed the main mission "Ad Astra Per Aspera." After completing this mission, exit the bunker where you meet Faust. You’ll see the ruins of the wooden building ahead and the stash is near some beds.

  • Wanderer Suit

Duga

#1

To find this Journalist Stash, you'll need to progress through the main story until you unlock the Duga region. Once you're there, head south and find the large warehouse. As soon as you enter the warehouse, a powerful Burer mutant will appear. This creature will levitate objects and fire them at you. Defeat the Burer and go upstairs to find a control panel with a red button. Press the button to unlock a gate at the back of the warehouse. Return to the ground floor and go through the newly opened gate. You’ll find the stash in the lockers nearby.

  • 2 Journalist's Audio Messages
  • SA-U "Gabion" special-ops rifle

Some journalist Stashes , mostly the ones in corners, are blocked and can be unlocked after progressing through the story.

item.title: How to Catch the Ancient Depth Serpent in Fisch
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find the Ancient Depth Serpent in Fisch
  • How to Catch the Ancient Depth Serpent

As befits a fishing simulator, Fisch has a huge number of different fish. Most of them can be caught after a few tries. But when it comes to Exotic rarity, things get much more complicated. So, in this guide, you will learn how to catch the Ancient Depth Serpent in Fisch .

This fish is undoubtedly one of the rarest in this Roblox game. This is not surprising since even just getting to its habitat is a challenge, especially for new players.

Where to Find the Ancient Depth Serpent in Fisch

As you can guess from the name, the Ancient Depth Serpent is not introduced in the usual locations. Therefore, players will have to go to ancient, long-forgotten places in the depths of the Ocean. In other words, you must visit the Depths to catch the Ancient Depth Serpent in Fisch .

This location is one of the most difficult to access in the game. The entrance to it is in the Vertigo location, which can be reached by jumping into one of the strange whirlpools. But the entrance there is blocked by huge gates. To open them, you need to meet two conditions:

  • Complete the Vertigo Bestiary.
  • Find the Depths Key.

Both of these conditions can be fulfilled at the same time since the Depths Key only spawns in Vertigo waters. This includes strange whirlpools, in which you can catch Isonade. Once you complete this quest, all you have to do is talk to the NPC near the gate to enter the Depths and get one step closer to the Ancient Depth Serpent in Fisch .

How to Catch the Ancient Depth Serpent

Once you have opened the gates and completed a short course on the way to the Depths location, you need to start preparing for fishing.

The Ancient Depth Serpent is of Exotic rarity, so you will need the best bait in Fisch . The in-game description tells players to use the Truffle Worm. However, we also recommend that you stock up on Shark Head bait.

You should also use a suitable fishing rod. The best options would be the Rod of The Forgotten Fang or the Celestial Rod. But the good old Steady Rod will also work.

It is important to note that most of the time the Ancient Depth Serpent is not available for catching in Fisch , as you need to wait for the Absolute Darkness event. It happens randomly and exclusively in the Depths location. During it, an abundance area of the Ancient Depth Serpent appears at a random point in the location. Players have a chance to get this Exotic catch only at this time and in this place.

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy 2 Could Set the World on Fire With a Magical New Feature
item.description:
With the release of Hogwarts Legacy , Avalanche Software was able to deliver what many call the dream Harry Potter game. For the first time in an AAA title, players were able to explore Hogwarts, attend classes, and tell their own story rooted in the mythology of the iconic series. Because of its success, a Hogwarts Legacy 2 already seems to be looming on the horizon. And while there are many routes it could go, one addition could take the Hogwarts Legacy concept to incredible new heights.

Hogwarts Legacy aimed to deliver an authentic Harry Potter experience, and although it was not perfect, it mostly delivered on that promise. Now that the foundations have been laid, Avalanche has the chance to expand upon it immensely with new classes, stories, locales, and Wizarding World secrets. But perhaps the greatest addition could come in the form of actual spellcrafting. As long as it sticks true to the lore of the franchise, a feature such as that may be exactly what the next adventure needs.

Hogwarts Legacy 2 Could Dive Deep Into the Wizarding World

Harry Potter Has an Extensive History With Spellcrafting

Spellcrafting may simply sound like a fun way to combine iconic spells, but it is actually rooted in the Harry Potter mythos. Throughout the franchise's timeline, many different witches and wizards created spells. Some of them barely did anything, while others became extremely important parts of the story. In fact, one of the major plot points of Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince is the spells that Severus Snape created and filled an old potions book with. Additionally, many fans believe that Voldemort and Hermione created spells during their time.

Spellcrafting itself is no easy task, because if it was, then every wizard would likely try to do it. Only witches and wizards with a great understanding of magic have been able to create their own spells. Not only do they have to craft the incantation, but they also have to create the wand movements. While it is unknown just how exactly they go about doing that, it is known to be very dangerous, and sometimes even fatal to the one creating the spell. And because of all of that, it sounds like it could be a fantastic addition to the next Hogwarts Legacy .

Hogwarts Legacy 2 Could Take Spells to Whole New Heights

If Hogwarts Legacy 2 tapped into this part of the Harry Potter lore, then it could lead to something truly special. Players would be able to combine some of their favorite spells, create the wand movement, give it a creative name, and then unleash it onto their enemies. Through this, players could get all sorts of unique spells and effects, making no two playthroughs alike. Plus, if Avalanche wanted to take it even further, it could let them actually share said spells with each other.

If Avalanche wanted to include something like this, it could follow in the footsteps of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion . In that game, players who joined the Mages Guild could earn the ability to create their own spells using the Alter of Spellmaking. This allowed them to combine learned magical effects into something much more powerful. What ensued was a pretty fun system that sadly did not make its way to Skyrim , but Hogwarts Legacy 2 could fill that void.

Of course, Avalanche would need to come up with some story reason why the player character is powerful enough to do this. However, it has already made the protagonist a chosen one of sorts, so there is seemingly no reason it could not expand upon that idea further. Even if the spellmaking feature was fairly limited, its inclusion could be a fantastic treat for fans, and lead to some extremely memorable moments in the process.
